sentences.sContent: He was enchanted with the euphonious music .
sentences.sContent_eng: He was enchanted with the euphonious music .
sentences.sCn: 他陶醉在那悦耳的音乐中。

sentences.sContent: Prescott's style, though in his diary he wrote " bother euphony ", is euphonious .
sentences.sContent_eng: Prescott's style, though in his diary he wrote " bother euphony ", is euphonious .
sentences.sCn: 普雷斯科特虽然在日记里写“ 讨厌的谐音”， 可是他写文章的风格还是有点油腔滑调。

sentences.sContent: "The music wasn't bad, " Kathy replied. "I thought the violin and the piano produced a euphonious combination. "
sentences.sContent_eng: "The music wasn't bad, " Kathy replied. "I thought the violin and the piano produced a euphonious combination. "
sentences.sCn: “音乐还不错，”凯西回答，“我觉得小提琴和钢琴演奏出了悦耳的合音。”

remMethod.val: eu (好) + phon (声音) + ious → 好听的声音 → 悦耳的

words.tran: 悦耳的，语调好的；音调上的
悦耳之音；悦耳；和谐的声音

trans.tranCn: 悦耳的， 声音和谐的
trans.tranOther: denoting or relating to euphony; pleasing to the ear
